Description: Shallow, light brown, concave, wheel-thrown, pottery plate with small, flat base. The walls are slightly warped, having slight depressions in some areas and raised areas in others. On the interior of the plate, concentric rings can be seen where the different ceramic parts that compose the bowl are joined together. The base is uneven, having several areas of gray encrustations adhered to it. The bottom of the bowl is also covered with specks of a dark brown coloring. Overall, the surface is rough in texture and has many chips and scratches, especially along the lip.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Spurlock Museum, University of Illinois. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Cf. EA23688 and EA23686, Leclère & Spencer 2014, Tell Dafana Reconsidered, pl.31.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IB.002)
